snippet: Narayana Kocherlakota, president of the Minneapolis Fed, said, cited his outlook for overly low inflation and high unemployment in his statement.
abstract: Minneapolis Fed president Narayana Kocherlakota says Federal Reserve has not done enough to reduce costs of borrowing to raise economic growth, citing his outlook for overly low inflation and high unemployment.
lead_paragraph: Narayana Kocherlakota, president of the Minneapolis Fed, said, cited his outlook for overly low inflation and high unemployment in his statement.

headline.main: Fed Official Says It Has Not Done Enough for Growth
headline.print_headline: Fed Official Says It Has Not Done Enough For Growth
